skill.name: test/echo-tool
skill.description: A tool that echoes its input for testing
skill.summary: A simple tool that echoes back input text for testing AI tool integrations
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 3 findings, all determined to be false positives. SKILL.md is a YAML/markdown fixture containing documentation and metadata, not executable code. Line 29 shows a CLI usage example, lines 5 and 13 contain version and description metadata. No dangerous code patterns present.

medium_findings.title: Shell Command Pattern Misidentified
medium_findings.description: Static scanner detected 'bash' pattern at SKILL.md:29, identified as potential shell execution
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Lines 29-31 contain CLI documentation showing tool usage, not actual shell execution code

content.value_statement: This tool returns the input text exactly as provided. It serves as a foundational test skill for verifying AI tool execution and response handling.
actual_capabilities: Returns exact input text as JSON output
Works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
limitations: Returns text exactly as provided without transformation
No support for complex operations or logic
No file system or network access
Output format is fixed JSON structure

use_cases.title: Test Suite Development
use_cases.description: Verify that AI tools execute correctly and return expected output structures
use_cases.target_user: Developers building test suites for AI integrations

use_cases.title: Tool Integration Validation
use_cases.description: Confirm that tool calls are properly wired and responses parse correctly
use_cases.target_user: AI tool authors and framework developers

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Testing
use_cases.description: Validate command-line tool execution in automated testing environments

prompt_templates.title: Basic Echo Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the test/echo-tool to echo the text: 'Hello World'

prompt_templates.title: Variable Input Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Run test/echo-tool with the input text set to '${MESSAGE}'

prompt_templates.title: Response Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute test/echo-tool and verify the output contains the exact input string

prompt_templates.title: CLI Integration Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Test that the CLI correctly passes input to test/echo-tool and returns structured JSON

best_practices: Use simple, predictable input text for reliable test results
Verify output structure matches expected JSON format
Run in isolated test environments before production deployment
anti_patterns: Avoid complex or multi-line input strings that may parsing issues
Do not assume transformation or processing of input text
Avoid using the tool for production data processing tasks

faq.question: What does the echo tool do?
faq.answer: It returns the input text exactly as provided in a JSON output structure.

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The echo tool works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code platforms.

faq.question: Can I use this for production tasks?
faq.answer: This is a testing tool. It lacks features needed for production workloads.

faq.question: What output format does it use?
faq.answer: Output is always JSON with an 'output' field containing the input text.

faq.question: Does it modify the input text?
faq.answer: No, the tool returns text exactly as provided with no transformation.

faq.question: Is this tool safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a read-only testing utility with no side effects.
